Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Dozens of people lined the sidewalks that had been swept just hours prior, fussing with their belongings, setting up new tents, and discreetly selling wares to one another.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: residing in the area after a sweep; setting up new tents

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Many unhoused people, including Robinson, say it can be challenging to identify and retrieve their belongings at the facility.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: experiencing challenges with the city's storage facility

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Between December 2022 and June of this year, a federal injunction prevented the city from penalizing people for sleeping on public property without an alternative offer for shelter.
Document Sources.Source Justification: federal court ruling guiding city policy

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to a federal survey released in May, more than 8,000 unhoused people in the city, which has fewer than 4,000 shelter beds to offer.
Document Sources.Source Justification: official statistics on homelessness and shelter capacity

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Public Works policy... clearly spells out how soiled items can be handled and our crews follow the policy and consistently apply its terms.
Document Sources.Source Justification: guiding policy for city's handling of encampment belongings

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: All they do is tell me to go back to the Hunters Point Navigation Center. And I don’t want to do that. I had bad experiences,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: experiencing homelessness; prior negative experiences with navigation center

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: I don’t understand,”; “bits of silver.”; “You’re going to have to pick it up later.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: experiencing homelessness; interacting with law enforcement during sweep

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Typically, with city sweeps, they give 72 hours of notice with location and time, and we were following that, but they didn’t follow that usual rule,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Communications and Policy Director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: representing the Coalition on Homelessness; critiquing city's sweep practices

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: the policy clearly spells out how soiled items can be handled and our crews follow the policy and consistently apply its terms.”

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: According to Mayor London Breed, the intention is to clean up sidewalks and force unhoused people into the city’s labyrinthine network of shelter and supportive housing programs.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: stating the city's policy intention regarding homelessness

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: In order to bring public attention to the moral question of sweeps, the Coalition on Homelessness and other unhoused advocates planned to crash an encampment sweep in SoMa last Thursday,
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: organizing advocacy efforts around homelessness and sweeps

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Public Works employees began examining and collecting O’Brien’s possessions as soon as he was detained, without giving him the sorting time required by policy.

Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: enforcing city policy on encampments; handling possessions
